conclusion: Analyze electric field and potential at center O before and after placing charge at C.
Points A, B, and C form an equilateral triangle with equal magnitude like charges at A and B.
Center O is equidistant from A, B, and C.
Electric field due to point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Electric fields from A and B at O are equal in magnitude but opposite in direction along line joining O to midpoint of AB.
Components of electric fields from A and B perpendicular to AB cancel out, leaving net field along line perpendicular to AB through O.
Equal magnitude opposite sign charge -q is placed at point C.
Electric field at O due to charge at C is in opposite direction to resultant field from A and B.
Net electric field at O is E - E = 0.
Electric potential due to point charge q at distance r is V = kq/r.
Initial potential at O due to charges at A and B is V = 2 * kq/r.
After placing charge at C, potential at O is V = kq/r + kq/r - kq/r = kq/r.
Magnitude of electric field strength at O is 0 and electric potential is kq/r.
